Class SpringSecurityUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • grails.plugin.springsecurity.SpringSecurityUtils

extends Object
    Helper methods.

    Burt Beckwith

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • NO_ROLE

        public static final String NO_ROLE
        Used to ensure that all authenticated users have at least one granted authority to work around Spring Security code that assumes at least one. By granting this non-authority, the user can't do anything but gets past the somewhat arbitrary restrictions.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • authoritiesToRoles

        public static Set<String> authoritiesToRoles(Object authorities)
        Extract the role names from authorities.
        Parameters:
        authorities - the authorities (a collection or array of GrantedAuthority).
        Returns:
        the names

      • getPrincipalAuthorities

        public static Collection<org.springframework.security.core.GrantedAuthority> getPrincipalAuthorities()
        Get the current user's authorities.
        Returns:
        a list of authorities (empty if not authenticated).

      • parseAuthoritiesString

        public static List<org.springframework.security.core.GrantedAuthority> parseAuthoritiesString(String roleNames)
        Split the role names and create GrantedAuthoritys for each.
        Parameters:
        roleNames - comma-delimited role names
        Returns:
        authorities (possibly empty)

      • retainAll

        public static Set<String> retainAll(Object granted,
                    Object required)
        Find authorities in granted that are also in required.
        Parameters:
        granted - the granted authorities (a collection or array of SpringSecurityUtils).
        required - the required authorities (a collection or array of SpringSecurityUtils).
        Returns:
        the authority names

      • ifAllGranted

        public static boolean ifAllGranted(String roles)
        Check if the current user has all of the specified roles.
        Parameters:
        roles - a comma-delimited list of role names
        Returns:
        true if the user is authenticated and has all the roles

        Returns:

        Note - only for use by plugins during bean building.

        Parameters:

      • getProviderNames

        public static List<String> getProviderNames()
        Authentication provider names. Plugins add or remove them, and can be overridden by config.
        Returns:
        the names

      • registerFilter

        public static void registerFilter(String beanName,
                  SecurityFilterPosition order)
        Register a filter bean name in a specified position in the chain.

        Note - only for use by plugins during bean building - to register at runtime (preferably in BootStrap) use clientRegisterFilter.

        Parameters:
        beanName - the Spring bean name of the filter
        order - the position

      • registerFilter

        public static void registerFilter(String beanName,
                  int order)
        Register a filter bean name in a specified position in the chain.

        Note - only for use by plugins during bean building - to register at runtime (preferably in BootStrap) use clientRegisterFilter.

        Parameters:
        beanName - the Spring bean name of the filter
        order - the position (see SecurityFilterPosition)

      • getOrderedFilters

        public static Map<Integer,String> getOrderedFilters()
        Ordered filter names. Plugins add or remove them, and can be overridden by config.
        Returns:
        the names

      • clientRegisterFilter

        public static void clientRegisterFilter(String beanName,
                        SecurityFilterPosition order)
        Register a filter in a specified position in the chain.

        Note - this is for use in application code after the plugin has initialized, e.g. in BootStrap where you want to register a custom filter in the correct order without dealing with the existing configured filters.

        Parameters:
        beanName - the Spring bean name of the filter
        order - the position

      • clientRegisterFilter

        public static void clientRegisterFilter(String beanName,
                        int order)
        Register a filter in a specified position in the chain.

        Note - this is for use in application code after the plugin has initialized, e.g. in BootStrap where you want to register a custom filter in the correct order without dealing with the existing configured filters.

        Parameters:
        beanName - the Spring bean name of the filter
        order - the position (see SecurityFilterPosition)

      • getConfiguredOrderedFilters

        public static SortedMap<Integer,Filter> getConfiguredOrderedFilters()
        Set by SpringSecurityCoreGrailsPlugin; contains the actual filter beans in order.
        Returns:
        the filters

      • isSwitched

        public static boolean isSwitched()
        Check if the current user is switched to another user.
        Returns:
        true if logged in and switched

      • getSwitchedUserOriginalUsername

        public static String getSwitchedUserOriginalUsername()
        Get the username of the original user before switching to another.
        Returns:
        the original login name

      • getSecurityConfigType

        public static String getSecurityConfigType()
        Lookup the security type as a String to avoid dev mode reload issues.
        Returns:
        the name of the SecurityConfigType

      • reauthenticate

        public static void reauthenticate(String username,
                  String password)
        Rebuild an Authentication for the given username and register it in the security context. Typically used after updating a user's authorities or other auth-cached info.

        Also removes the user from the user cache to force a refresh at next login.

        Parameters:
        username - the user's login name
        password - optional

      • doWithAuth

        public static Object doWithAuth(groovy.lang.Closure closure)
        Execute a closure with the current authentication. Assumes that there's an authentication in the http session and that the closure is running in a separate thread from the web request, so the context and authentication aren't available to the standard ThreadLocal.
        Parameters:
        closure - the code to run
        Returns:
        the closure's return value

      • doWithAuth

        public static Object doWithAuth(String username,
                groovy.lang.Closure closure)
        Authenticate as the specified user and execute the closure with that authentication. Restores the authentication to the one that was active if it exists, or clears the context otherwise.

        This is similar to run-as and switch-user but is only local to a Closure.

        Parameters:
        username - the username to authenticate as
        closure - the code to run
        Returns:
        the closure's return value

      • getSecurityContext

        public static org.springframework.security.core.context.SecurityContext getSecurityContext(HttpSession session)

      • getLastException

        public static Throwable getLastException(HttpSession session)
        Get the last auth exception.
        Parameters:
        session - the session
        Returns:
        the exception

      • getLastUsername

        public static String getLastUsername(HttpSession session)
        Get the last attempted username.
        Parameters:
        session - the session
        Returns:
        the username

      • getSavedRequest

        public static org.springframework.security.web.savedrequest.SavedRequest getSavedRequest(HttpSession session)
        Get the saved request from the session.
        Parameters:
        session - the session
        Returns:
        the saved request
